titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Helen Morris Beitler (1915-2002) was a collector of books and 19th and early 20th century ephemera. Her areas of interest included the trades and tools, children's literature, boating, advertising, and Philadelphia and Pennsylvania history.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of miscellaneous 19th century printed and manuscript ephemera. Materials include: advertising cards, blotters, and labels; business cards; bill heads, receipts, and printed envelopes; tickets; calendars; product catalogues; programs; manuscript receipts, bill heads, shipping orders, bank drafts, and insurance certificates; and a small batch of Sitgraeves and Scott family letters (1810s and 1820s). Many of the manuscript bill heads and receipts are related to the business of ports, customs houses, and shipping suppliers and outfitters.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Helen Beitler collection.
